learning_outcomes.description: use a dictionary to look up unfamiliar characters and words
read both simplified and traditional Chinese charactersto HSK 2 level
improve general writing skills in Chinese to HSK 2 level

assessments.task_description:
This diagnostic test evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). The diagnostic task will be conducted during the classes (at the contacts and tutorials) from Week 1-2. The quiz will take about 5 mins.

AI/MT Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Character practice booklet and workbook (1): Lesson 7- 10 (Textbook 1)
assessments.task_description:
Students are required to complete both the character practice booklet and exercise sheet of each new lesson covered in this course. This assessment will cover the character booklet and exercise sheet from Lesson 7 to 10 (Textbook 1).

(1) Character practice booklet: Regular practice of the Chinese characters covered in this course is an important part of your learning. You should write 10 times for each new character taught. You will be assessed for correct and aesthetically-acceptable character production. You can find the grid paper on Blackboard

(2) Workbook: The exercise sheets that review the taught lessons will be posted on Blackboard. E-copies and answer key are downloadable on Blackboard. Students are also required to check against the answer key and note down their correction (if there’s any). Completion of the exercise sheets will help prepare students for the exams that contain similar question types seen in the exercise sheets.

AI/MT Statement

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit their practice booklet and worksheets (1) via Turnitin by Friday 12th September, 5pm.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In-Semester exam will be conducted in the tutorial (Thursday) session in WEEK 7, and this will be a closed-book exam. It will be based on the Integrated Chinese Textbook 1 Lesson 7-10. It will also test learning materials relating to the Textbook Units used in the lectures and tutorials. 

Duration: 60 minutes

Preparation guidelines will be available in Blackboard.

AI/MT Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Character practice booklet and workbook (2): Lesson 1- 4 (Textbook 2)
assessments.task_description:
Students are required to complete both character practice booklet and exercise sheet of each new lesson covered in this course. This assessment will cover the character booklet and exercise sheet from Lesson 1 to 4 (Textbook 2).

(1) Character practice booklet: Regular practice of the Chinese characters covered in this course is an important part of your learning. You should write 10 times for each new character taught. You will be assessed for correct and aesthetically-acceptable character production. You can find the grid paper on Blackboard

(2) Workbook: The exercise sheets that review the taught lessons will be posted on Blackboard. E-copies and answer key are downloadable on Blackboard. Students are also required to check against the answer key and note down their correction (if there’s any). Completion of the exercise sheets will help prepare students for the exams that contain similar question types seen in the exercise sheets.

AI/MT Statement

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit their practice booklet and worksheets (2) via Turnitin by Friday 31st October, 5pm.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This will be a closed-book exam. It will be based on the Integrated Chinese Textbook 1 Lesson 7-10 and Textbook 2 Lesson 1-4. It will also test learning materials relating to the Textbook lessons used in the lectures and tutorials. 

Duration: 90 minutes

Preparation guidelines will be available in Blackboard.

AI/MT Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
